alert.note: Alert for Jasper; Lake; Newton; Porter (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued March 01 at 11:53AM EST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...Heavy rainfall and flooding possible by late week... A strong storm system moving into the region by late week will is expected to bring a combination of rain and snow along its track. Heavy rainfall totals may occur in areas that receive mostly liquid precipitation, and this rainfall may lead to flooding of rivers and poor drainage areas. This flood potential exists from Friday through the weekend depending on the track of the system. Due to recent wet weather, soils across the area have a high moisture content. Rivers also remain elevated. These antecedent conditions reduce the amount of rainfall necessary to cause flooding. At the present time, the most likely overlap between heavy liquid precipitation and favorable antecedent conditions is roughly near and south of I-80. River forecast guidance based upon a range of rainfall possibilities indicates a wide range of river levels by the weekend, including rivers remaining relatively steady near bankfull and some rivers rising to above moderate flood stage. This outlook means that elevated water levels and potential impacts are possible, but not yet certain. Persons should closely monitor forecasts including the possibility of flood watches, warnings, and advisories. This outlook will be updated by tomorrow morning.
